Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the Speaker to file or join with the Administration in filing, on behalf of the Council, a brief in support of the Plaintiffs-appellees in the litigation captioned Tapia v. Successful Management Corp., Index No. 400563/08.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following four Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Ignizio, Ulrich, Vallone, Jr., and Oddo.


Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Support of the Plaintiffs-appellees in the litigation captioned Tapia v. Successful Management Corp., Index No. 400563/08.

Items.Title: A Resolution. in support of the Plaintiffs in the litigation captioned The United States of America v. The State of Arizona, Case No. CV 10-1413-PHX (SRB); in support of all branches of federal, state and local government using their power to oppose the Arizona law, including banning government employees from using public funds to travel to Arizona; and endorsing the Council's decision to file an amicus brief in support of the federal action at its discretion.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Boycott of the State of Arizona in response to its anti-immigrant legislation.

Items.Title: A Resolution. in support of the Plaintiffs in the litigation captioned The United States of America v. The State of Arizona, Case No. CV 10-1413-PHX (SRB); in support of all branches of federal, state and local government using their power to oppose the Arizona law, including banning government employees from using public funds to travel to Arizona; and endorsing the Council's decision to file an amicus brief in support of the federal action at its discretion.
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following seven Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Gentile, Halloran, Ignizio, Nelson, Ulrich, Vallone. Jr, and Oddo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Boycott of the State of Arizona in response to its anti-immigrant legislation.
